Dear Dr. Kolodchin:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
September 27, 2018. Due to the violations, a written corrective action plan is required. It
should be noted that violations of any licensing statutes rules and are also violations of
the ISEP and your contract. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of
this letter and must include the following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or MSA citation.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, a regular license will be issued. If
you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action will result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (248) 975-5053.

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the
following:
R 400.4113 Employee records.
An institution shall maintain employee records for each
employee and shall include documentation of all of the following
information prior to employment or at the time specified in this
rule:
(f) A record of any convictions other than minor traffic
violations from either of the following entities:
(i) Directly from the Michigan state police or the
equivalent state law enforcement agency, Canadian province, or
other country where the person usually resides or has resided in
the previous 5 years.
In addition to completion of an ICHAT for the employee before
hire, to show ongoing compliance to this rule, the agency
requires an annual ICHAT for all employees.
One of eight employee records reviewed where the employee
was employed over one year showed the employee’s annual
ICHAT due by 8/4/18 was not completed.
R 400.4113 Employee records.
An institution shall maintain employee records for each
employee and shall include documentation of all of the following
information prior to employment or at the time specified in this
rule:
(i) Documentation from the Michigan department of human
services, the equivalent state or Canadian provincial agency, or
equivalent agency in the country where the person usually
resides, that the person has not been determined to be a
perpetrator of child abuse or child neglect. The documentation
shall be completed not more than 30 days prior to the start of
employment and every 12 months thereafter.
Three of eight employee records reviewed did not show
compliance:
Two employee records showed the employee’s Department
clearance was completed more than 30 days prior to the
employee’s respective 6/14/18 and 12/11/17 date of hire.
4

A third employee’s record did not show documentation of an
annual Department clearance for the employee, due by 7/28/18.
R 400.4128 Initial staff orientation and ongoing staff training.
(4) Training opportunities for direct care staff shall include, but
are not limited to, all of the following:
(h) First aid.
The agency requires current first aid/CPR certification at the
time of hire and ongoing.
Two of eight employee records reviewed did not show
documentation of compliance:
One record showed the employee’s first aid/CPR training was
obtained 9/12/18, almost three months after the employee’s
6/14/18 date of hire.
A second record showed the employee’s first aid/CPR
certification expired December 2017.
R 400.4153 Shelter care and detention institutions; preliminary service
plans.
Within 7 calendar days of admission, a plan shall be developed
for each
resident. The plan shall include all of the following:
(a) The reason for care.
(b) An assessment of the resident’s immediate and specific
needs.
(c) The specific services to be provided by the institution.
(d) Other resources to meet the resident’s needs.
Two of three open records reviewed did not have a completed
preliminary service plan.
Repeat Violation Interim 2015.

IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
R400.4132 Grievance procedure.
The agency was apprised its shall clearly show their grievance policy was provided to
the resident, their family and the referral source, not just indicate it was discussed
with them.
R400.4166 Discharge Plan(c).
The agency shall more clearly document its assessment of the child needs that
remain to be met.
V. CONSULTATION
R400.4166 Discharge Plan(d).
The agency was advised that placing a footnote on its discharge plan form that it
does not provide services after discharge, it refers for follow up services as
appropriate, may aid it in documenting clearer compliance to the rule.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
The facility has submitted one acceptable corrective action plans not related to
maltreatment during this licensing period.
This corrective action plan related to its 2017 Interim Inspection where it received
seven rule citations; R400.4113(e) and (g) for Employee records; 400.4114 for
Tuberculosis screening for employees and volunteers; R400.4128(3) for Initial staff
orientation and ongoing training; R400.4152(a)and(i) for Initial documentation; and
R400.4167 (1)(d) for Discharge plan. The agency submitted an acceptance
corrective action and plan and has completed that corrective action plan. It received
no repeat violations. It is worth reporting the agency was provided consultation and
technical assistance related to aspects of the discharge plan rule to assist them with a
clearer understanding of the rule and documentation of compliance to it.
The agency’s prior named Chief Administrator is no longer with the agency. The
agency’s Licensee has taken over that role until such time a replacement is hired. The
agency continues to move forth in its efforts to meet its resident’s needs.
6

VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules and/or ISEP requirements and/or contract/policy. Upon
receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that the facility will
be issued a renewal of their regular license.
